an11.14:4.1: And then Venerable Subhūti together with the mendicant Saddha went up to the Buddha,
an11.14:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an11.14:4.4: “Subhūti, what is the name of this mendicant?”
an11.14:4.5: “Sir, the name of this mendicant is Saddha. He is the son of the layman Saddha, and has gone forth out of faith from the lay life to homelessness.”
an11.14:5.1: “Well, I hope this mendicant Saddha exhibits the outcomes of faith.”
an11.14:5.3: Now is the time, Holy One, for the Buddha to speak on the outcomes of faith.
an11.14:5.4: Now I will find out whether or not this mendicant Saddha exhibits the outcomes of faith.”
an11.14:6.1: “Well then, Subhūti, listen and pay close attention,
an11.14:7.1: “Firstly, a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, and has appropriate behavior and means of collecting alms. Seeing danger in the slightest flaw, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
an11.14:7.3: this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:8.1: Furthermore, a mendicant is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and understanding them with right view.
an11.14:8.4: this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:9.1: Furthermore, a mendicant has good friends, companions, and associates.
an11.14:9.2: When a mendicant has good friends, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:10.1: Furthermore, a mendicant is easy to correct, having qualities that make them easy to correct. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.
an11.14:10.2: When a mendicant is easy to correct, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:11.1: Furthermore, a mendicant is skilled and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for their spiritual companions, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.
an11.14:11.2: When a mendicant is skilled and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:12.1: Furthermore, a mendicant loves the teachings and is a delight to converse with, being full of joy in the teaching and training.
an11.14:12.2: When a mendicant loves the teachings, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:13.1: Furthermore, a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unwholesome qualities and gaining wholesome qualities. They are strong, firmly applied, not slacking off when it comes to developing wholesome qualities.
an11.14:13.2: When a mendicant is energetic, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:14.1: Furthermore, a mendicant gets the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
an11.14:14.2: When a mendicant gets the four absorptions, this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:15.1: Furthermore, the Realized One recollects many kinds of past lives, that is,
an11.14:15.2: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand lives; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world evolving, many eons of the world contracting and evolving. They remember:
an11.14:15.3: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else.
an11.14:15.4: There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’
an11.14:15.5: And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
an11.14:15.6: When a mendicant recollects many kinds of past lives,
an11.14:15.9: this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:16.1: Furthermore, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, a mendicant sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
an11.14:16.2: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind. They spoke ill of the noble ones; they had wrong view; and they chose to act out of that wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
an11.14:16.3: These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’
an11.14:16.4: And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
an11.14:16.5: When a mendicant has clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman,
an11.14:16.6: this is an outcome of faith.
an11.14:17.1: Furthermore, a mendicant has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
an11.14:17.2: When a mendicant has ended the defilements,
an11.14:17.3: this is an outcome of faith.”
an11.14:18.1: When he said this, Venerable Subhūti said to the Buddha:
an11.14:18.2: “Sir, the outcomes of faith for a faithful person that the Buddha speaks of are found in this mendicant; he does exhibit them.
an11.14:22.1: This mendicant is easy to correct …
an11.14:23.1: This mendicant is skilled and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties …
an11.14:26.1: This mendicant gets the four absorptions …
an11.14:27.1: This mendicant recollects their many kinds of past lives …
an11.14:28.1: This mendicant has  clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human …
an11.14:29.1: This mendicant has ended the defilements …
an11.14:29.3: The outcomes of faith for a faithful person that the Buddha speaks of are found in this mendicant; he does exhibit them.”
an11.14:30.2: So, Subhūti, you should live together with this mendicant Saddha.
an11.14:30.3: And when you want to see the Realized One, you should come together with him.”
